Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Defendants decoded and distributed 2,009 copyrighted TV programs without authorization
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Statutory damages awarded at reduced rate
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiffs to prove infringement and number of works
Crimes.Legal_Rule: s. 38.1 allows statutory damages between $500 and $20,000 per work, with discretion to adjust based on proportionality
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unauthorized reproduction and distribution of copyrighted content
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Defendants defaulted; opportunity to respond was available
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Number of infringed works (2,009), lack of licensing in Canada, minimal revenue loss
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Copyright Act regime for statutory damages
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Obtaining fair and proportionate statutory damages
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Electronic records, website content, expert testimony on distribution
